p: The population sizes ranged from 38 infants in a hospital setting [ 94] up to 48 million inhabitants of England and Wales [ 98]. The dynamics regarding age and social mixing in the population were modeled static (i.e. constant) [ 85] or dynamic (with ageing, mortality, newborns, weddings) [ 92, 100]. Ajelli and Merler [ 103] were exceptional in that they provided an explicit approach to model household dynamics over time to enable IBM simulations on long time-scales.
